the side in the contract that is for sale.\r ","params":{"_buyBuyerSide":"Buying the buyer side or the seller side?\r","_collateral":"DAI amount\r"}},"calculateCollateralAmount(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bool)":{"details":"Calculate the collateral amount for one party given the current\r     market price and original strike price, notional amount and the\r     amount the party has deposited into the contract.\r ","params":{"_depositBalance":"Balances of deposits into the contract\r","_isBuyer":"Buyer or Seller / Long or short party?\r ","_marketPrice":"Current market price\r","_notionalAmount":"CFD notional amount\r","_strikePrice":"CFD strike price\r"},"return":"collateral Amount of collateral for the party\r"},"calculateNewNotional(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Calculate new notional amount after a side has been sold at a new\r     strike price.\r      * Formula is:\r N2 = N1 * S2 / S1\r Where:\r N1 = previous notional\r S1 = previous strike price\r S2 = sale strike price\r ","params":{"_newStrikePrice":"New / Sale strike price.\r","_oldNotional":"Existing notional.\r","_oldStrikePrice":"Existing strike price.\r"},"return":"newNotional Result of the calculation.\r"},"cancelNew()":{"details":"Cancels a newly created contract refunding the balance to the party\r     that created the contract. This can only be called before a contract\r     is initiated. ie. between the createNew() and deposit() calls.\r"},"changeInDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Calculate the change in contract value based on the price change.\r","params":{"_currentPrice":"Current market price\r"}},"changeStrikePrice(uint256)":{"details":"Party can update the strike price of an non-initialized contract\r"},"createByUpgrade(address,address,address,address)":{"details":"Create a new CFDinstance from a previous CFD instance. This is part\r     of the upgrade process (see CFD.upgrade()).\r ","params":{"_cfdAddr":"Address of the existing / old CFD\r","_cfdRegistryAddr":"Address of CFDRegistry contract\r","_feedsAddr":"Address of Feeds contract\r","_registryAddr":"Address of Registry contract\r"}},"createNew(address,address,address,address,bytes32,uint256,uint256,bool)":{"details":"Create a new CFDinstance specifying the terms of the contract.\r ","params":{"_cfdRegistryAddr":"CFD Registry contract address\r","_feedsAddr":"Feeds address\r","_isBuyer":"Flag indicating if the contract creator wants to take the\r           buyer (true) or the seller side (false).\r","_marketId":"Contract is for prices on this market\r","_notionalAmountDai":"Contract amount\r","_partyAddr":"Address of the party creating the contract\r","_registryAddr":"Registry contract address\r","_strikePrice":"Strike price\r"}},"cutOffPrice(uint256,uint256,uint256,bool)":{"details":"Calculate the cut off price for buyer or seller.\r      * This is the price that if passed would raise a liquidation event.\r      * Base Formulas are:\r    Buyer:  1.05 * S - depositBalanceLong  * S / N\r    Seller: 0.95 * S + depositBalanceShort * S / N\r      * However for Solidity we need to adjust parts by FACTOR_UINT to ensure\r no fractions.\r ","params":{"_depositBalance":"Balance of deposits for one party\r ","_notionalAmountDai":"Contract notional amount\r"},"return":"cut off price\r"},"deposit(uint256)":{"details":"Counterparty deposits their funds into the contract thereby joining\r and initiating the contract.\r"},"isActive()":{"details":"Contract has been initiated (has 2 parties) and not yet terminated.\r","return":"true if contract is active\r"},"isBuyerSelling()":{"details":"Is buyer / long party selling.\r","return":"true if buyer has side up for sale\r"},"isContractParty(address)":{"details":"Check if the given address is one of the 2 parties of the contract.\r","params":{"_party":"Address to check\r"},"return":"true if _party is either the buyer or seller.\r"},"isSellerSelling()":{"details":"Is seller / short party selling.\r","return":"true if seller has side up for sale\r"},"isSelling(address)":{"details":"If the given party is selling one side of the contract.\r","return":"true if the given party is selling\r"},"liquidate()":{"details":"This will disolve the contract and return each parties balance of\r collateral.\r"},"liquidateMutual()":{"details":"This functions allows a mutual liquiidation of the contract. It\r     requires both parties call it. The contract will be liquidated\r     when the second party calls it.\r"},"liquidateMutualCancel()":{"details":"Cancel the intent to liquidate mutually. This reverses a previous\r intent to liquidate by the account liquidateMutualCalledBy.\r"},"marketPriceInRange(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Checks if given parameters and given market price result in a price\r     inside an allowable range. This range is defined by the ContractForDifferenceLibrary.cutOffPrice\r     function formulas. The idea is that as parameters change - leverage,\r     market price etc., we must check the change doesn't result in a\r     liquidation event due to too little collateral.\r ","params":{"_marketPrice":"Current market price\r"},"return":"true if in range; false if not\r"},"percentChange(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Return a percentage change comparing a value with a new value.\r","params":{"_newValue":"The new value to compare the change against\r","_value":"The existing value to compare against\r"},"return":"Percentage change (eg. _value = 100, _newValue = 90 then return 10)\r"},"percentOf(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Return a percentage of a given amount.\r","params":{"_amount":"Amount to calculate the percentage of\r","_percent":"Percent amount (1 - 100)\r"}},"sellCancel()":{"details":"Cancel the for sale status setup by sellPrepare()\r"},"sellPrepare(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Position in a contract can be sold to another party. This function\r     makes the callers side available for sale. A party can buy the side\r     with the buy function.\r","params":{"_desiredStrikePrice":"Sellers desired sell strike price\r","_timeLimit":"Sale available until this time in UNIX epoch seconds\r                 (< now for no limit)\r"}},"sellUpdate(uint256)":{"details":"Seller can update the price on the sale.\r"},"status()":{"details":"Derive status from the state variables.\r","return":"Status reflecting the current state.\r"},"topup(uint256)":{"details":"Party adds more funds to the contract thereby increasing their\r     deposit balance.\r","params":{"_value":"DAI amount\r"}},"transferPosition(address)":{"details":"Parties can transfer contract ownership to another address by\r     calling this function.\r","params":{"_newAddress":"Addreess of the new party to swap in.\r"}},"upgrade()":{"details":"Upgrade contract to a new version. This involves creating a new CFD\r     at the latest contract set - transferring over all properties and\r     value from this one to the new one.\r      *      For INITIATED status an upgrade requires a call to this function\r     from both parties. The upgrade will happen when the second party\r     makes the call.\r      *      For CREATED status an upgrade only requires a call from the single\r     contract party.\r"},"withdraw(uint256)":{"details":"Party withdraws funds from the contract.\r     They can only withdraw down to an amount that leaves the collateral\r     to notional difference at 20% or more.\r","params":{"_withdrawAmount":"Amount to withdraw from the deposits balance.\r"}}},"title":"Contract for difference\r  * Contract for difference for a given market between a\r \"buyer\" (long position) and \"seller\" (short position).\r"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"forceTerminate()":{"notice":"Force terminate executed by one party who will penalised 5% of their\r collateral. Then penalty will be sent to the counterparty.\r"},"getCfdAttributes()":{"notice":"Returns an array with all the attributes of the contract\r (Had to split in 3 functions because of the stack limit)\r Max number of return values == 8\r"},"liquidate()":{"notice":"Daemons will call this routine when the market price has moved enough\r that the closeRatio for this contract has been reached. It can\r actually be called by anyone who is willing to pay the gas for the\r liquidate.\r      * If the market has not moved past the liquidate threshold the call\r will be rejected.\r ol":{"keccak256":"0x079c4e23ee448f529e43bfa3c4e8fb4be52cd0318ee923a276835bedf45b93d8","urls":["bzzr://48248e86f64407a95f241d6c5c8cfea6b4d4ebf4ebb467e5c98c8af3868fafe4"]}},"version":1}

buy(bool,uint256).details: Buy the side in the contract that is for sale.

params._buyBuyerSide: Buying the buyer side or the seller side?

calculateCollateralAmount(uint256,uint25.details: Calculate the collateral amount for one party given the current     market price and original strike price, notional amount and the     amount the party has deposited into the contract.

params._depositBalance: Balances of deposits into the contract
params._isBuyer: Buyer or Seller / Long or short party?

calculateCollateralAmount(uint256,uint25.return: collateral Amount of collateral for the party

calculateNewNotional(uint256,uint256,uin.details: Calculate new notional amount after a side has been sold at a new     strike price.      * Formula is: N2 = N1 * S2 / S1 Where: N1 = previous notional S1 = previous strike price S2 = sale strike price

cancelNew().details: Cancels a newly created contract refunding the balance to the party     that created the contract. This can only be called before a contract     is initiated. ie. between the createNew() and deposit() calls.

changeInDai(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: Calculate the change in contract value based on the price change.

changeStrikePrice(uint256).details: Party can update the strike price of an non-initialized contract

createByUpgrade(address,address,address,.details: Create a new CFDinstance from a previous CFD instance. This is part     of the upgrade process (see CFD.upgrade()).

params._cfdAddr: Address of the existing / old CFD

createNew(address,address,address,addres.details: Create a new CFDinstance specifying the terms of the contract.

params._isBuyer: Flag indicating if the contract creator wants to take the           buyer (true) or the seller side (false).
params._marketId: Contract is for prices on this market
params._partyAddr: Address of the party creating the contract

cutOffPrice(uint256,uint256,uint256,bool.details: Calculate the cut off price for buyer or seller.      * This is the price that if passed would raise a liquidation event.      * Base Formulas are:    Buyer:  1.05 * S - depositBalanceLong  * S / N    Seller: 0.95 * S + depositBalanceShort * S / N      * However for Solidity we need to adjust parts by FACTOR_UINT to ensure no fractions.

params._depositBalance: Balance of deposits for one party

deposit(uint256).details: Counterparty deposits their funds into the contract thereby joining and initiating the contract.

isActive().details: Contract has been initiated (has 2 parties) and not yet terminated.

isBuyerSelling().return: true if buyer has side up for sale

isContractParty(address).details: Check if the given address is one of the 2 parties of the contract.
isContractParty(address).return: true if _party is either the buyer or seller.

isSellerSelling().return: true if seller has side up for sale

isSelling(address).details: If the given party is selling one side of the contract.
isSelling(address).return: true if the given party is selling

liquidate().details: This will disolve the contract and return each parties balance of collateral.

liquidateMutual().details: This functions allows a mutual liquiidation of the contract. It     requires both parties call it. The contract will be liquidated     when the second party calls it.

liquidateMutualCancel().details: Cancel the intent to liquidate mutually. This reverses a previous intent to liquidate by the account liquidateMutualCalledBy.

marketPriceInRange(uint256,uint256,uint2.details: Checks if given parameters and given market price result in a price     inside an allowable range. This range is defined by the ContractForDifferenceLibrary.cutOffPrice     function formulas. The idea is that as parameters change - leverage,     market price etc., we must check the change doesn't result in a     liquidation event due to too little collateral.
marketPriceInRange(uint256,uint256,uint2.return: true if in range; false if not

percentChange(uint256,uint256).details: Return a percentage change comparing a value with a new value.

params._newValue: The new value to compare the change against
params._value: The existing value to compare against

percentOf(uint256,uint256).details: Return a percentage of a given amount.

params._amount: Amount to calculate the percentage of

sellCancel().details: Cancel the for sale status setup by sellPrepare()

sellPrepare(uint256,uint256).details: Position in a contract can be sold to another party. This function     makes the callers side available for sale. A party can buy the side     with the buy function.

params._timeLimit: Sale available until this time in UNIX epoch seconds                 (< now for no limit)

sellUpdate(uint256).details: Seller can update the price on the sale.

status().details: Derive status from the state variables.

topup(uint256).details: Party adds more funds to the contract thereby increasing their     deposit balance.

transferPosition(address).details: Parties can transfer contract ownership to another address by     calling this function.

params._newAddress: Addreess of the new party to swap in.

upgrade().details: Upgrade contract to a new version. This involves creating a new CFD     at the latest contract set - transferring over all properties and     value from this one to the new one.      *      For INITIATED status an upgrade requires a call to this function     from both parties. The upgrade will happen when the second party     makes the call.      *      For CREATED status an upgrade only requires a call from the single     contract party.

withdraw(uint256).details: Party withdraws funds from the contract.     They can only withdraw down to an amount that leaves the collateral     to notional difference at 20% or more.

params._withdrawAmount: Amount to withdraw from the deposits balance.

devdoc.title: Contract for difference  * Contract for difference for a given market between a "buyer" (long position) and "seller" (short position).

forceTerminate().notice: Force terminate executed by one party who will penalised 5% of their collateral. Then penalty will be sent to the counterparty.

getCfdAttributes().notice: Returns an array with all the attributes of the contract (Had to split in 3 functions because of the stack limit) Max number of return values == 8

liquidate().notice: Daemons will call this routine when the market price has moved enough that the closeRatio for this contract has been reached. It can actually be called by anyone who is willing to pay the gas for the liquidate.      * If the market has not moved past the liquidate threshold the call will be rejected.
